subject: Programming
title: Pair Programming Psychology
description: A fast breakdown of Pair Programming Psychology for builders.

hook.text: Two programmers, one keyboard. The driver types, the navigator thinks. Together they catch more bugs.

buildup.text: Pair programming creates constant code review. Mistakes are caught in seconds, not days.

discovery.text: The real value isn't bug catching ‚Äî it's shared understanding. Two people now know the code.

twist.text: Pairing is exhausting. Full-day pairing leads to fatigue. Short focused sessions work better.

climax.text: Pairing is a social skill as much as a technical one. Trust and communication determine its success.

punchline.text: Two minds are faster than two keyboards.

quiz.question: What is the main benefit of pair programming beyond bug catching?
